titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Sprague deed and title search 1977.372
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-25 15:35:31 +0000.

did.unittitle: George Sprague deed and title search
did.abstract: Deed and title search (1875) for land transferred between George and Isabella Sprague and Herman Nickerson, all of Huntington, Long Island.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in one folder and has no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); George Sprague deed and title search, 1977.372, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Rehoused and finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in October 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains an 1875 deed for land between George Sprague and his wife, Isabella Sprague, of the town of Huntington in Long Island, N.Y., and Herman Nickerson, also of Huntington. Also included is a title search for the property referenced in the deed, which traces the ownership of the property between 1832 and 1875.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
